abstract: According to Rita Felski, context is overrated. Even in the sophisticated variants of contextualization typical of the New Historicism, she explains, scholarsâ€™ obsession with historical context as the ultimate source of textual meaning disregards the capacity of literature to resonate across time and space.
article_title: Topic Modeling, Epistemology, and the English and German Novel
publisher: Department of Languages, Literatures, and Cultures
